name: Lizard
description: Lizards are a widespread group of squamate reptiles, with over 6,000 species, ranging across all continents except Antarctica

name: Snake
description: Snakes are limbless reptiles with long, cylindrical bodies, scaly skin, lidless eyes, and a forked tongue.

name: Lion
description: The lion is a large mammal of the Felidae family. Some large males weigh over 250 kg. Today, wild lions live in sub-Saharan Africa and in Asia.

name: Elephant
description: Elephant, largest living land animal, characterized by its long trunk, columnar legs, flat ears.

name: Dog
description: Dogs (Canis lupus familiaris) are domesticated mammals, not natural wild animals. They were originally bred from wolves.

name: Horse
description: Horses are ungulates â€” mammals with hooves. They also have long tails, short hair, muscular torsos, long thick necks and elongated heads.

name: Panda
description: Giant pandas have a distinctive black and white coat, with black fur around their eyes and on their ears, muzzle, legs and shoulders.

name: Monkey
description: Monkeys live in trees, grasslands, mountains, forests, and on high plains. A group of monkeys is called a troop

name: Fish
description: Fish are cold-blooded. True fish have a backbone and fins. Most also breathe with gills and have scales that cover their bodies.
